primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the human courtroom of condemnation to reverse the verdict of 'Guilty' through the substitutionary death of Christ, moving the human from a state of 'death' to 'life'.

tekstueel_bewijs: The verdict has been dramatically reversed by the only one who has the power to reverse it
Jesus gave himself up to death
He himself became 'The Judge Judged in Our Place'
He 'set us free from the law of sin and death'
acquittal and life for all men
the answer that has been revealed to him by the true Father of us all
every single one of us is in the same group

helper.identificatie: The Spirit / The Law of the Spirit of Life
tekstueel_bewijs: through Christ Jesus the law of the Spirit of life has set me free

tegenstander.identificatie: The Law of Sin and Death / The Accusing Mother/Father
tekstueel_bewijs: the law of sin and death
the terror of being undone by our parents
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as an 'inexorable activity' like gravity, making it impossible for the human subject to overcome it alone.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformed life (Sanctification) where the believer lives according to the Spirit rather than the sinful nature.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (empowered by Christ)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher explicitly states that God does not just guarantee innocence to let us go back to old ways; the acquittal (Program 1) enables the transformation (Program 2).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Spirit → Christ ← Law of Sin and Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus gave himself up to death
God has not pronounced the verdict... solely in order to let us go back
He has brought us into the new sphere
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We can no more free ourselves
I can will the good, but I cannot do it
Dorothy... was now praying to the Lord

voorbeelden: every human being has a perfect conception of what kind of character he should have
I can will the good, but I cannot do it
the knowledge that we are 'not good enough'
the only one who has the power to reverse it

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human power (impotence) and the gift of divine power (competence) through Christ and the Spirit.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Guilty!), moves to ~S1 (The Law's demand), then through Christ to ~S2 (Acquittal) and finally S1 (No Condemnation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Judge Judged in our place'—Christ absorbs S2 to grant S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon uses psychological and cosmic imagery to establish the weight of guilt.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a textbook example of grace-oriented homiletics. It identifies the human as an incompetent subject and God/Christ as the active Subject of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: She was now praying to the Lord to help her be more patient

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Judge Judged in Our Place
inexorable activity... like the law of gravity

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Paul) are used as examples of shared human misery and need, not as moral heroes to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats Paul theocentrically.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief, gratitude, and a sense of being 'set free'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic justification followed by synergistic sanctification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the psychological experience of guilt with the theological reality of the Atonement.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'no condemnation' and the 'expectation to change' is handled via the 'new sphere' of the Spirit.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: he himself became 'The Judge Judged in Our Place'

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of 'Pouvoir-faire' (Power to do) where the human had only 'Vouloir' (Will).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total; compared to physical laws and inescapable parental dynamics.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's action. The human is correctly positioned as the 'Wretched Man' who receives the 'Object' (Acquittal) from the 'Sender' (God) through the 'Subject' (Christ).

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strongly weighted toward Pouvoir (Power), which is appropriate for this text.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Death/Parental Judgment) is already sufficiently intensified.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the active verbs while addressing deep human psychological needs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the effective use of the 'New Yorker' cartoon, semiotics reveals that the cartoon functions as an 'Opponent' actant that only God can defeat.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 8; semiotics shows how the sermon 're-stages' the courtroom of Romans 8 for the 1984 listener.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that the 'power' of the sermon comes from the 'Subject-Switch'—the hearer is relieved of the burden of being the Subject of their own salvation.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses secular literature (Camus, Conrad) to establish the 'Opponent' and 'Lack' before introducing the Divine Subject.
